results.title: Straw dogs (D)
results.creator_credit: Sam Peckinpah, Daniel Melnick and ABC Pictures (US)
results.brief_description: This violent story of rape and retribution is a masterpiece of thriller film-making, though argument still rages over Peckinpah’s confused mixture of primitive machismo and contemptuous elitism. David (Dustin Hoffman), a young American professor, moves into an isolated Cornish farmhouse with his English wife, Amy (Susan George). Their retreat is disturbed by the harrasment of workmen who are repairing the farmhouse. These brutal and stupid locals alternatively taunt the Professor and are lewdly suggestive with a willing Amy. It is not until Amy is savagely raped, and a local mentally handicapped man (David Warner) is also attacked by the mob, that David’s repressed anger is unleashed and he takes his murderous revenge on the “hick” locals. Peckinpah is arguably the most operatic of American directors and his theme of the lone individual male exacting punishment when society fails its victims was to influence films as diverse as “Death Wish” and the Dirty Harry trilogy. Pauline Kael called “Straw Dogs” “a fascist work of art”. The film still unsettles and disturbs: it’s misogyny is hateful, it’s resolution undeniably exhilerating.

results.title: Street Hero
results.brief_description: Vince Colosimo is a young guy living in a world of drugs, illegal gambling and cruising cop cars. The only thing that keeps him above the mire of petty criminals is his music. The guy’s a drummer in a school band. He’s got the chance to improve his status in the local “Mafia” and they’re pushing for a decision, “Vinnie, you either go it alone, or you join us and get on in the world.”

results.title: Vegetable Growing at Home
results.creator_credit: Jack Keane and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: This short film is a government-produced educational film designed to encourage viewers to grow their own vegetables at home during the Second World War. Produced by the Victorian Department of Agriculture, the film features a suburban couple who receive a brochure in the mail called ‘Wartime Vegetable Growing at Home’. The educational intent of the film is interspersed with comic scenes predicated on the (now outdated) gender roles of the time as the domestic housewife, Mary, sabotages her husband’s plans to play golf and convinces him to start a vegetable garden. With the assistance of the girl next door, a student at the Burnley School of Horticulture, the hapless husband begins transforming his patch of grass and stops sulking. Moving to an instructional section filmed at the Burnley School of Horticulture, the film’s narrator explains how to dig a patch, turn over and rake the soil, and plant seeds, with the process performed by another expert female gardener (despite clearly being a skilled professional, the narrator mocks her for being a woman). The gardener then demonstrates how to thin out young plants, cultivate the soil and deal with pests, with occasional interludes back to the comic scenes of the domestic couple. Finally, the film shows the rewards of growing your own vegetables, with a bountiful harvest from the garden.

results.title: Strangers on a train
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on Patricia Highsmith’s chilling thriller, “Strangers on a train”, this is one of Alfred Hitchcock’s most suspenseful and exciting films. Two passengers accidentally meet on a train. Bruno Anthony (Robert Walker) offers to kill the wife of Guy Haines (Farley Granger), if Guy in return murders Bruno’s father. The excellent script was co-written by Raymond Chandler and the film features a climax in a fairground which is among Hitchcock’s finest directing moments.

results.title: Strange planet
results.creator_credit: Emma-Kate Croghan, Anastasia Sideris, Stavros Kazantzidis, New South Wales Film and Television Office and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: Emma-Kate Croghan made a great splash with her debut feature “Love and other catastrophes”; this, her follow-up work, was less successful, being a somewhat formulaic tale about love and destiny. The narrative centres around three friends, Alice, Judy and Sally, who are adrift in their late 20s, looking for love, career prospects and direction in life. Unbeknownst to them, three eligible men are also on similar paths, dealing with a variety of catastrophes and missteps. Will these six find love, career fulfilment and buffering from the trials and tribulations of life? Probably. Cast includes: Claudia Karvan, Naomi Watts, Alice Garner, Tom Long, Felix Williamson and Hugo Weaving.

results.title: Stravinsky
results.creator_credit: Wolf Koenig, Roman Kroitor, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An informal study of the great but extremely human dean of modern composers, a man past eighty, (at the time of making this film) full of the joy of life and, though proudly American, still very much an Old World figure with a long and alert memory for people and events in music, literature and art. The main focus of the film is Igor Stravinsky conducting the CBC Symphony Orchestra in a recording of his Symphony of Psalms.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wolf Koenig, Roman Kroitor, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Strangers at the door
results.creator_credit: John Howe, Maxine Samuels and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: It had been a hard journey for immigrants Jan Laluckey and his family. But on arrival in Quebec, the New World, all their hopes for a new and better life were dampened when immigration officials refused to allow Kasia, Jan’s daughter, to remain. During a routine medical examination it was found that Kasia had contracted an infectious eye disease. In the end she was separated from her family and sent back to Europe alone. Cast: George Popovich, Elaine Reade, Maruska Stankova, Vlasta Vrana.

results.title: Tractor driving
results.brief_description: Very clearly this film gives hints on the maintenance, driving and safety precautions to be taken with a tractor. “A well maintained machine will be a safer machine and give you better value over its work life.”

results.title: Strange events = Quelle strane occasioni
results.creator_credit: Luigi Comencini, Luigi Magni, Anonimo and Rizzoli Film
results.brief_description: This is a three-part tour de force featuring three of Italy’s best known comic actors coping with the trials and tribulations of love and sex. In the first story, Paolo Villagio plays an Italian immigrant who unwittingly becomes an entertainer in an Amsterdam porno parlour to make ends meet. The second story tells of a middle-aged man (Nino Manfredi) who is introduced to the permissive world of today’s youth by his teenage dughter and the daughter of an overnight visitor from Sweden. The third story features Roman comedian Alberto Sordi as a Monsignor and Stefania Sandrelli as a young lady who become accidentally locked in an elevator together on a warm mid-summer’s bank holiday. In Italian with no subtitles.

results.title: Strange invaders
results.brief_description: This entertaining animation tells the story of a strange evening in the night of a happy husband and wife. The nightmare begins with a child like creature landing head first in their house, its feet flaming. At first they are very happy with this odd foundling and like many new parents take numerous photos of the arrival. Aided by a telescope, the baby communicates with its own - chaos is inevitable. The wife leaves, taking the dog. The sad man is left a great mess. The theme of this comedic short is the trials and joys brought about with the arrival of a child.
